item.title: Hellraiser: Revival’s First Gameplay Trailer Is Hellish And Horrible
item.content:encoded:
The first gameplay trailer for Hellraiser: Revival has dropped, and it’s absolutely not for the faint of heart. If you thought the debut trailer was wince-worthy, this is just as nasty and as vile as you’d expect. It’s heaven, in hell.

A pleasant (also unpleasant) surprise dropped in July 2025 with a Hellraiser: Revival Trailer, revealed by Saber Interactive. It marks the first time the horror title has ever had its own standalone game, and the first gameplay trailer shows that you should expect every bit of the nastiness of the movies rolled into one.

Hellraiser: Revival Has Some Cenobite

Insider Gaming’s hands-on Gamescom preview tells you everything you need to know about Hellraiser: Revival.

An “hour-long theater of violence and sadism” was one of many lines we used. Now, you can see the evidence for yourself through the first Hellraiser: Revival gameplay trailer. It has everything a Hellraiser fan is looking for: Nudity, graphic violence, and a sprinkling of Pinhead.

There’s also a lot of visceral combat, a look into the game’s brand-new story, and you also get a look at the game’s insistence on going the extra length with platforming and puzzling.

You can check out the footage for yourself, if you dare. All jokes aside, viewer discretion is advised.

Feel free to share your thoughts on the Hellraiser gameplay trailer. Is it as bad as you thought it was going to be? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to discuss the trailer and the Hellraiser franchise.

For more news, check out the report that Resident Evil Requiem ‘Definitely’ Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, and Reanimal Getting Its Release Date Confirmed. You can read all of this and more right here at Insider Gaming.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem ‘Definitely’ Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
An insider has stated that Resident Evil Requiem is definitely getting at least one DLC, which is currently in development.

Resident Evil Requiem doesn’t arrive until next year, and as we wait for the game’s launch, the only things getting us by are leaks. We recently saw the producer address rumours about the photo of Leon Kennedy with an eye patch that surfaced online. Now, an insider has revealed some details about the DLC.

Resident Evil Requiem DLC Might Star Alyssa

The details about the Resident Evil Requiem DLC come from Dusk Golem (Aesthetic Gamer), known for RE leaks. Their latest post on X (formerly Twitter) states, “There’s definitely at least one DLC for Resident Evil Requiem in development right now. I’ve heard about it a few times, believe it stars Alyssa.” The leaker had previously stated that Alyssa Ashcroft is also the giant monster following Grace in the trailer, and will be playable for a bit in the game.

Dusk Golem was also asked on the same day whether Leon Kennedy is being considered the main character or a side character in the upcoming title. Golem replied that they don’t have a blueprint for the game to give that answer, but they do know that Leon has “some very large levels, the biggest in the series to date”. Players should take both details with a grain of salt, as it does not come from an official source.

In other news, Capcom expects Resident Evil Requiem to sell better than Resident Evil Village. Additionally, the developers recently revealed why they ditched the multiplayer aspect of the title. What are your thoughts on the new claims about Resident Evil Requiem definitely having at least one DLC in development? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about PlayStation Plus members getting free Winter Soldier skins in Marvel Rivals. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Golden Joystick Awards 2025 – All Award Winners
item.content:encoded:
On November 20, the Golden Joystick Awards 2025 took place in London, and there was no shortage of awards to be given out to the various winners this year.

It’s the 43nd-Annual edition of the Golden Joystick Awards, and it featured 24 awards and dozens of games both large and small sharing the stage for the show. Nearly all of the awards are voted on by the fans with just four being decided by a panel of critics and creators. Those four awards are: Streamers’ Choice, Breakthrough, Critics’ Choice, and Lifetime Achievement.

Check out the full list of award nominees and winners below and let us know what your thought of the fan’s choices in the comments or official Insider Gaming Discord server. The winners of each award appear and are bolded as they are announced.

Golden Joystick Awards 2025 Winners

Best Storytelling

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (WINNER)
  • SILENT HILL f
  • Blue Prince
  • Mafia: The Old Country
  • Lost Records: Bloom & Rage
  • The Hundred Line – Last Defense Academy

Best Audio Design

  • Ghost of Yōtei (WINNER)
  • Battlefield 6
  • Donkey Kong Bananza
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Two Point Museum
  • Cronos: The New Dawn

Best Multiplayer Game

  • Battlefield 6
  • PEAK (WINNER)
  • ELDEN RING NIGHTREIGN
  • Split Fiction
  • Mario Kart World
  • REMATCH

Best Visual Design

  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (WINNER)
  • The Midnight Walk
  • Ghost of Yōtei
  • Sword of the Sea
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows

Best Game Expansion

  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle: The Order of Giants
  • Lies of P: Overture (WINNER)
  • No Man’s Sky: Voyagers
  • Atomfall Story Expansion Pack: The Red Strain
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows – Claws of Awaji
  • Still Wakes the Deep: Siren’s Rest

Best Indie Game – Self Published

  • Hollow Knight: Silksong (WINNER)
  • Hades II
  • Sword of the Sea
  • PEAK
  • Keep Driving
  • Spilled!
  • Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders
  • DELTARUNE
  • Promise Mascot Agency
  • Consume Me

Best Indie Game

  • Blue Prince
  • Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector
  • Wanderstop
  • Skin Deep
  • despelote
  • Herdling
  • Abiotic Factor
  • Baby Steps
  • Caves of Qud
  • Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor

Studio of the Year

  • Team Cherry
  • Sandfall Interactive (WINNER)
  • Aggro Crab and Landfall
  • Bloober Team
  • Sloclap
  • Rebellion

Best Early Access Game

  • Grounded 2
  • Schedule I
  • 9 Kings
  • R.E.P.O. (WINNER)
  • skate.
  • White Knuckle

Best Soundtrack

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (WINNER)
  • South of Midnight
  • SILENT HILL f
  • Eriksholm: The Stolen Dream
  • DELTARUNE
  • Sword of the Sea

Best Game Trailer

  • Grand Theft Auto VI Trailer 2 (WINNER)
  • Battlefield 6: Official Launch Live Action Trailer
  • Rhythm Doctor – Official Release Date Trailer
  • The Expanse: Osiris Reborn – Announcement Trailer
  • ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN – Announcement Trailer
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance II Official CGI Trailer – Live a Life Medieval

Still Playing Award – Mobile

  • Call of Duty: Mobile
  • Pokémon GO (WINNER)
  • Subway Surfers
  • Clash Royale
  • Honkai: Star Rail
  • Genshin Impact
  • Zenless Zone Zero
  • Roblox
  • Free Fire
  • PUBG MOBILE

Still Playing Award – PC and Console

  • Minecraft (WINNER)
  • Dead by Daylight
  • HELLDIVERS 2
  • NARAKA: BLADEPOINT
  • Satisfactory
  • Call of Duty: Warzone
  • Marvel Rivals
  • Fortnite
  • Apex Legends
  • Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six Siege X
  • GTA Online
  • Warframe

Streamer’s Choice

  • PEAK (WINNER)

Best Remake / Remaster

  • METAL GEAR SOLID Δ: SNAKE EATER
  • The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered (WINNER)
  • Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter
  • The Talos Principle: Reawakened
  • Gears of War: Reloaded
  • Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4

Breakthrough Award

  • Schedule I (WINNER)

For more Insider Gaming, sign up for our weekly newsletter.
